AND All rule checks are ran

title: Club is able to e-sign from a single c form

custom_steps:

AND this modal cannot be dismissed
AND this modal has a countdown timer beginning at 35

title: BOC wants to approve a single Add C

GIVEN that user is BOC
AND user is viewing a single Add C
AND that Add C is Pending, Tendered or Preliminary
custom_expected:

AND it is available in view and edit mode
AND if it is pressed in Edit mode, any changes are saved and the form reloads in view mode
AND all rule checks are run as if from the multi-C widget ([overridable warnings](http://10.4.36.21/testrail/index.php?/suites/view/1363&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc&group_id=11989) and [hard errors](http://10.4.36.21/testrail/index.php?/suites/view/1363&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc&group_id=11988))
AND the Add C shows up black in contract history
AND blue notification appears

title: As a club, I want to know if my e-signature submissions failed or passed when submitting multiple C's for e-sign
As a club, I want to view a list of people who can be Authorized signatories
custom_steps:
**Business Value**
This introduces a new widget called Authorized Signatories that allow clubs to maintain a list of signatories and permissions in order to sign forms  

**Wireframe**
http://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=authorized_signatory_negotiator

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Introduce a new widget titled "Signatories & Negotiators"
- Widget lives under the Salary structures widget for now (Temp location)
- Widget default population is a list of Signatories entered by the logged in Org. Note that it might be easier to manually re-enter this information into ebis 2 rather than ETL this info from Ebis 1. 
- Note each club will maintain its own list.  e.g.; Club A will not be able to see Club B's data.
- For now, the widget should have the following columns:
Last Name
First Name
Title
Updated *(format = mm/dd/yyyy)*
Mj UPC
Mn UPC
Add C
Negot
- Default sort on Last name column 
- Widget should have standard global features - sort, export, refresh, maximize and quick filter
- Last Name and First Name columns should be frozen
- Checkmarks should be the global green checkmark

title: As a club, I want to edit the list of Authorized Signatories
custom_steps:
**Business Value**
Allows club to update the Auth signatories

**Wireframe**
http://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=edit_an_authorized_signatory_negotiator

http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=adding_a_row (error handling reference)

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Existing rows should always be editable. 
- User can add new rows or delete existing rows
- All columns except 'Updated' column become editable
- Clicking edit on a row places focus in the Name input
- Name and Title are free type columns. The other columns are checkboxes. 
- None of the fields have default populations. Check boxes are unchecked by default
- The updated column is auto-populated by system with date modified last by user
- Last Name, First name and Title are required fields. If user hits Save, the rows that are missing these fields, show hard error for these required fields. See #104727464 for more details on how this error should work.
- Success notifications and errors must follow the global framework in terms of look and feel and workflow
- Required fields should have a red "*" to the right of the column header that is only visible if one more columns is in edit mode
- Checkmarks in view mode should use the proper font-awesome icon, font-size and color

title: As a user I want the Addendum H to be included in a Minor Contract to be based off of the Country of Signing field rather than the Birth Country
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* The Country of Signing field needs to be required if an Addendum H is included in the contract. 
* If no country is selected when the user attempts to print the MN Contract, no Addendum H is printed, even though it is included in the contract. 
* If "Venezuela" is selected when the user attempts to print the MN Contract, the Venezuelan Addendum H prints. 
  *Note that a different version prints for the VZ add H depending on the player's age*
* If "Australia" is selected when the user attempts to print the MN Contract, the Australian Addendum H prints. 
* If any other country is selected when the user attempts to print the MN Contract, the Non-VZ Addendum H prints.

title: As BOC, I want to give players a day of service when he has a service accruing roster status
custom_preconds: GIVEN logged in as BOC
custom_steps: WHEN the user views a breakdown of a players MJ service
custom_expected:
THEN the "Current Season Service" days is the number of days he has gotten service in the current season including today
AND the player accrues a day of service for each day he has one of the following roster statuses:

DFA – Designated for Assignment (exceptions covered later)
15D – 15 Day DL
15R – Rehab 15 Day DL
7DC – 7 Day Concussion DL
7CR – Rehab 7 Day Concussion DL
60D – 60 Day DL
60R – Rehab 60 Day DL
BRV – Bereavement List
PTR – Paternity List
MIL – Military Leave
ACT – Active
PND – Active pending contract
SUS – Suspended

title: As BOC, I want to see a player's total MLS
custom_preconds: GIVEN logged in as BOC
custom_steps: WHEN the user runs the MJ Service Batch
custom_expected:
THEN Using the "Current Season Service" value, update the player's Total MLS on the service tab on his player profile and the player header.
AND To get the total MLS, add the Current season MLS to Prior season MLS.
AND Major League Service is displayed as "XX.YYY"; "X" is the full season year while "YYY" is the number of days in the current season. A player earns a full season by accruing 172 days of Major League Service.  For example, "1.105" means that a player have  one full year (172 days) plus 105 days of Major League Service.
AND XX will increment once YYY reaches 171.  For example, if a player is at 1.171, the next value would be 2.000.

AND Table is not editable

AND Show table with following columns (other columns implemented later and should not be added to page)
- Date - Show a row for every date starting from Opening day to Last day of season. Most recent on top
- MJ Roster Status EOD - MJ Roster status for the player at the end of each of those days
- Org EOD - Org of player at end of each date
- MJ service - Check mark if player got service that day.  Blank otherwise
- MJ Day - Start count of service day so 1st day of service would be 1, 2nd day is 2 etc.

title: As BOC, I want to calculate Option days for a player
custom_preconds: GIVEN logged in as BOC
custom_steps: WHEN user views the Batch tab under System Admin
custom_expected:
THEN there is a new batch under Service called "Option / Outright Days"
AND Similar to the MJ service batch, it has a parameter for player ID. 
AND It can be run in report mode, test mode and update mode
AND Batch always recalculates from the beginning of the season
AND Player population is the same as MJ Service batch


AND If player's MJ Roster status is 'Optioned' at any point during the day, that day counts as an Option day
AND Keep track of how many total Option days the player had in the current season. If player is currently on Option, count the # of days in his current assignment
AND Populate the "Option Day" column on the 'Breakdown' section of a player's service page. This should count up similar to 'MJ Day' column
AND Update the 'Option Days - Current Season' and 'Option Days - Current Assignment' fields on the transaction tab.

AND the results table has the following columns:
Player ID
Player Name
Current Org
Current Club
MJ Roster Status
MN Roster Status
Option Days
Outright Days

AND the following global AC are followed:
- Batch can be aborted
- Show progress bar when processing
- Any errors are returned in results
- Previous batch results can be viewed
- Batch can be run in Test mode where the batch changes can be reversed
- Batch can be run in Update mode where they are actually changed

0.1% upto 9.9% , the penalty is 75% of overage value

0% upto 4.9% - None

15% or greater, show penalty as Loss of first round picks for next 2 years
